newsArray.title: ورزش افغانستان در سال ۲۰۲۵ میلادی
newsArray.description: Afghanistan’s Sports in 2025: Historic Wins, Challenges, National Pridenajibullah.lalzoyThu, 01/01/2026 - 00:51 Author Hamayoun Ashna Profile Photo Author Job Head of Sport Desk Sport In 2025, Afghanistan experienced notable sporting developments and achievements alongside political, economic, social, and cultural events.During the year, Afghanistan’s under‐17 futsal team competed in the third Asian Youth Games in Bahrain and, after defeating Uzbekistan, Bahrain, China, Thailand, and Iran, won a historic gold medal.Afghan futsal players also participated in the Islamic Solidarity Games in Saudi Arabia. In their opening match, they defeated Tajikistan, drew 2–2 against Iran, but lost to Morocco and were eliminated from the tournament without winning a medal.At the domestic level, the fourth season of the Afghanistan Futsal Premier League was held in Kabul, where the Sadaqat team claimed the championship title.Beyond futsal, Afghanistan’s national football team failed to qualify for the AFC Asian Cup after recording two draws against Pakistan and suffering defeats to Myanmar and Syria, drawing criticism from fans and analysts.In the national football champions league, Abu Muslim Farah emerged as champions after earning the highest number of points and defeating their rivals.In cricket, Afghan players did not perform strongly in overseas competitions. Afghanistan’s national cricket team participated for the first time in the ICC Champions Trophy in Pakistan. The Blue Tigers lost their opening match to South Africa, defeated England in their second match, and their third match against Australia was abandoned due to rain.In the same year, at the Asia Cup hosted by the United Arab Emirates, Afghanistan was eliminated in the group stage after losing to Sri Lanka and Bangladesh and securing one win against the UAE.Afghanistan also took part in a triangular cricket series in the UAE, defeating Pakistan and then the UAE, but failing to stop Pakistan in the final.During a tour of Zimbabwe, Afghan cricketers won all three Twenty20 matches against the hosts but lost the Test match.In the most significant domestic cricket event, the tenth season of the Shpageeza Cricket League was held, with Amo defeating Mes Aynak to win the championship.Meanwhile, following Pakistani military airstrikes in Paktika province, several Afghan cricket players lost their lives. In response, the Afghanistan Cricket Board canceled all bilateral cricket matches with Pakistan.Beyond cricket, Afghan athletes competed in more than ten sporting disciplines at the ninth Islamic Solidarity Games in Saudi Arabia. In Muay Thai, taekwondo, and wushu, Afghan athletes won gold, silver, and bronze medals.Afghanistan’s national volleyball team finished as runners‐up in the Central Asian Zone Championship in Bangladesh.International badminton competitions were also held in Afghanistan, with Uzbekistan’s national team winning the championship.The fourth season of the Volleyball Premier League was hosted in Kabul, where the Sra Myasht team claimed the title.Additionally, the seventh season of the Buzkashi Premier League was held with the participation of foreign riders. Sar‐e‐Pol won the championship, while Badakhshan finished as runners‐up.Afghan athletes participated in international competitions both as teams and individuals, winning dozens of medals.In the final days of 2025, Ali Bilal, the runner‐up of the Olympia world championship, visited Afghanistan and received a warm public welcome.
creator: homayoun.ashna

newsArray.ai_tag: ONLY AVAILABLE IN PROFESSIONAL AND CORPORATE PLANS

newsArray.title: Destiny’s child: Astrologer’s daughter Vaishnavi Sharma has the makings of a star
newsArray.description: The 20-year-old left-arm spinner Vaishnavi Sharma took five wickets in her debut series against Sri Lanka; "When Vaishnavi was born, I made her horoscope... there were strong indications for sports and also for becoming a doctor," her father Narendra Sharma said.
creator: shankar narayan

newsArray.title: The largely-forgotten hurler who helped 'light a hurling fire in Kilkenny which is still blazing away'
newsArray.description: A pity Jack Rochford is not better remembered - he was part of Kilkenny’s first golden age Jack Rochford of Tulla, Threecastles was reckoned to be the best hurling full back in Ireland during the early years of the last century. He won seven senior All-Ireland medals with Kilkenny between 190
creator: sam matthews
